relation: You will see a police officer on duty around the campus or in the dorms
They are really big on getting involved around campus
You can go bowling in the Huskie den and you can play pool. There are some parties that go on sometimes. You can also go out to eat and catch a movie.
The food is very good! Just eat right and exercise and you will not gain that freshmen 15

Dorm life is fine. Do not listen that rumor about dorming with your friends. If you feel that it is going to be a problem then feel free to live with a new person. But be prepare to talk about certain things that you will want to happen in the room. If there is not clear communication, then you guys will not get along. Oh yeah the community bathroom with gross you out. If you living with all girls like I do, they bathroom may not every stay clean.

Nothing is perfect but there are some teachers that can really help you make it throught their class. But if you do not use the people around you then you will not better yourself. The staff can only do what they can to help you so help them help you.

If you do not know what you are majoring in, it is okay. You can take the time to look up information about the many different programs that the University have and make a choice then. Do not feel bad about switching your major. Do what you feel is right for you.

It is a place where if you need help, there are many people there who are willing to help you. Take the time to look in to the many options that they have and take that and learn from it. Do not be afraid to ask any questions that you may have. No question is every a dumb question to the students or the staff.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Study hard and don't underestimate the material. You may think this is not a difficult college, but it can be very challenging. Even Communcations 101 was difficult. Bang for the buck Only $830/class. This is very good for a non-community college. The drom prices are what will hurt (nearly $1000/mo.), but appartments are only $275/mo. And with the top Accounting program and one of the best business colleges in the state, it certainly is a hefty discount. Am enjoying being here Sometimes it does get a bit boring. However, the people, at least the ones I am with, are great. It is a friendly environment and it is easy to meet people in classes, since many of the smaller classes end up being close. The social scene is fantastic. By the end of the first semester, almost everyone knows each other. This is something that does not happen at such a large university. Am learning a lot Some of the classes are pretty difficult and take a lot of studying, but this is a good thing.
